title: Marco Felluga 2014 Molamatta White (Collio)
description: A blend of 40% barrel fermented Pinot Bianco, 40% Friulano and 20%, Ribolla Gialla fermented in steel, this opens with aromas suggesting dried exotic fruit, coconut and oak-driven spice. The aromas carry over to the rather lean palate alongside a confectionery note and firm acidity. A walnut taste gives it a bitter finish.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Stainless Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Sweet apple blossom scents combine with a botanical element on the nose of this bottling, which also offers a grassy note. The crisp palate offers lemongrass at first, opening into riper pear flesh flavor and finishing with a touch of salt and candied lime tang.

title: Chateau de l'Oiselinière 2015 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This soft and fruity wine has open white fruit and citrus flavors. It is light and crisp with just the right amount of acidity. Coming from a warm year, it is richer than in other vintages, smoother and riper. Drink now.

title: Château Los Boldos 2015 Grande Réserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Lightly herbal berry fruit aromas are nothing you haven't seen before. In the mouth, this Cabernet is choppy and showing bold acidity. Flavors of plum and currant are racy and a touch spicy, while this is scouring on the finish.

title: Seufert 2014 Delfino Vineyard Dolcetto (Umpqua Valley)
description: Spicy cherry aromatics carry a touch of tack room leather. Those flavors follow, leading into drying tannins with a dash of dark chocolate. The wine seems a little confused about where it's heading, but it packs plenty of flavor at the moment. Drink up.

title: Trocard 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Crisp and with good acidity, this is a light, fruity and forward wine. Lively, balanced and with plenty of taut fruitiness at the end, it is very ready to drink.

title: Undurraga 2016 Sibaris Gran Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: This light-colored, almost clear, SB opens with pungent, fairly sharp aromas of sea brine and sweaty citrus fruits. In the mouth, this is tight, edgy and pointy due to blazing acidity. Citrus, bell pepper and green-herb flavors finish peppery and with scouring acidity.

title: Viña Tabalí 2013 Reserva Especial Cabernet Franc (Limarí Valley)
description: Reduced gritty foresty aromas revolve around herbal berry and plum fruit. This feels heavy, concentrated, tannic and slightly collapsed. Dark blackened herbal berry and chocolate flavors finish hard due to abrasive tannins and enamel-peeling acidity.

title: Vincze Béla 2008 Blauburger (Eger)
description: This Hungarian Blauburger is garnet in color, with aromas of cranberry, pomegranate and forest floor. It has flavors of sweet cherry and cranberry and a tart finish.

title: Whalebone 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Bolstered by 14% Petite Sirah, this bottling offers a stunning array of herb and earth scents that surround a core of black plum and minty licorice spice. The palate shows rounded purple fruit and more herbal notes, and the acidity is strong but balanced.

title: Smoke Tree 2016 Rosé (California)
description: Light and nutty, this combines a majority of Grenache with Zinfandel, Mourvèdre and Tempranillo. Fermented in stainless steel tanks, it maintains fresh acidity with its lightly ripe strawberry and watermelon fruit.

title: Villa Russiz 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Subdued aromas of pressed acacia flower, hay and beeswax take shape in the glass. The mature palate offers ripe yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside a note of toasted almond. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

title: Villabella 2016  Bardolino Chiaretto
description: This opens with aromas of wild berry, orchard fruit and a whiff of spring blossom. On the refreshing palate, bright acidity frames tangerine zest and wild raspberry. It finishes crisp and clean.

title: Viña Casablanca 2016 Nimbus Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: Briny citrus aromas are mild to the point of quiet. This clear-looking SB is in solid shape on the palate. Peppery lightly zesty flavors include a note of sweet green melon, while this tastes a bit like jalapeño peppers on the finish.

title: Viña Marty 2013 Ilaia Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Solid berry aromas don't go crazy with the oak, spice or herbal components. A chunky pulpy palate is a bit soft, while peppery herbal animal notes comfortably work their way into core blackberry flavors. Flavors of herbal fruits and cured meats lend quality to the finish.

title: Tertulia 2013 Phinney Hill Vineyard Carmenère (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Aromas of whole green pepper, hot spice, cherry and baking spice are followed by lighter styled, tart, silky-feeling fruit and barrel flavors.

title: Three Rivers 2014 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Reticent dark fruit and licorice aromas are followed by tart fruit flavors and lightly bunched-up tannins. There's interest but it doesn't all seem to come together.

title: Kovács Nimród 2012 Monopole Noir Pinot Noir-Syrah (Eger)
description: Aromas of red raspberry and red cherry lead into flavors of pomegranate juice and cherry cola. The finish is pleasantly acidic and medium in length in this interesting blend of Pinot Noir and Syrah.

title: La Cappuccina 2016  Soave
description: Aromas of wild flower and orchard fruit take center stage while the straightforward enjoyable palate offers ripe yellow pear and McIntosh apple. It's bright, with fresh acidity and a pleasantly bitter almond finish.

title: Quinta do Noval 2015 Cedro do Noval Branco White (Douro)
description: This is a lightly wood-aged wine, full of fruit with just a touch of spice. Smoothly textured, the wine is all the better for an extra year of aging before release. That broadens the fruit while leaving plenty of crispness and fine acidity. Drink now.

title: Undurraga 2016 Sibaris Gran Reserva Viognier-Roussane-Marsanne White (Maule Valley)
description: This blend of Viognier, Roussane and Marsanne isn't typically Chilean but it doesn't smell or taste all that French, either. Tropical floral aromas are similar to bath oil, while this feels full, pulpy and oily. Peach and persimmon flavors finish distinctly salty, with an oily feel and flavor notes of citrus peel.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Dona Helena Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
description: This is a light, bright blend of Castelão and Syrah. It has refreshing acidity and lively red fruits that give the wine a really crisp and fruity character. Drink now.

title: WesMar 2014 Oehlman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light and carbonic in tone, with a slight spritz to the acidity, this wine is ethereal, laced with black tea and tart cranberry flavors.

title: Wine by Joe 2015 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: Almost indistinguishable from an all-stainless Chardonnay, this nonetheless offers fine value and clean crisp flavors. The basics of simple white wine are here—green apple and tart lemon, served up fresh and immediately drinkable.

title: A Mano 2016 Rosato (Puglia)
description: Made with 75% Primitivo and 25% Aleatico, this has intense aromas suggesting white rose, crushed herb, Mediterranean scrub and wild berry. Mirroring the nose, the vibrant, easy-drinking palate offers sour cherry and orange zest alongside zesty acidity.

title: Attems 2016 Pinot Grigio (Venezia Giulia)
description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit and banana lead the nose. Bright and straightforward, the palate offers green apple and a nectarine note alongside zesty acidity that gives it a refreshing finish.

title: Château Peneau 2016 II Sauvignons  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This women-owned château above Cadillac produced a crisp wine, tight and nervy. With lively acidity, it focuses on the citrus side of life, finishing with a mineral edge. It will drink best from the end of 2017.

title: Clear Night 2015 Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Delicate whiffs of spring blossoms gain intensity on the palate of this easy-drinking, off-dry Riesling. Rounded and a bit plush, it's not a deeply concentrated or complex wine but the fresh apple and peach flavors are pleasant. Drink now.

title: Con un Par 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: This quiet Albariño comes from the Vicente Gandia family of wines. It opens with short, peppery aromas backed by a medium-bodied palate. Peppery, slightly bitter flavors echo the nose, with a hint of stone fruit to help it along. Drink now.

title: Concha y Toro 2015 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Privada Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Aromas of olive, mushroom and berry fruits are lightly herbal. This Cabernet feels scratchy, abrupt and edgy, while herbal raspberry and plum flavors finish solid and with a slight note of pickle.
